commit_message:
Make ResourceClass.normalize_name handle sharp S

Fixes ResourceClass.normalize_name to produce the same result in py2 and
py3 even when sharp S ('ß') is part of the input.

We do this by waiting until after replacing non-alphanumerics to upcase.

Change-Id: I431fa29d36d0d633374973fc25168344042d6c1a
Closes-Bug: #1762789

Review [1] added tripleo-upgrade to quickstart-requirements

Since ansible copy module doesn't insert new line

commit_message:
Add new line for quickstart-extras-requirement

Review [1] added tripleo-upgrade to quickstart-requirements
and it breaked deployments with reproducer script.
Since ansible copy module doesn't insert new line
in the quickstart-requirements, we need to explicitly
add it.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558210/

Change-Id: I10dcef66a0f04765f92ceefcca29be5a79ca4cf0

commit_message:
Fix dstat time penalty for failed runs

dstat async task with poll=0 should fire and forget, with 1 sec
max limit for the shell to run and send its process to bg.

The change includes:
 - Ignore errors on dstat play.
 - Enable dstat only when tempest runs.
 - Kills dstat before parsing logs and creating charts.
 - Remove dstat_count.

Closes-Bug: #1760917

Change-Id: I9ee407e8274f3ab6c3aea3650a25cd31772a81d6

- update the configuration to include multipath settings
- indicate unsupportability with HPE Nimble Linux Toolkit

commit_message:
Adding WWW-Authenticate info.

Sometimes when mistral requests are failing with "401 Unauthorized"
against keycloak, the reason are not mentioned in the logs.

In case keycloack return 401 it must provide the www-Authenticate
response header with the reason:
https://www.w3.org/Protocols/HTTP/1.0/spec.html#WWW-Authenticate

This code take care of it by adding the WWW-Authenticate value to
mistral api-log.

Change-Id: I7ae221aaeb2233184bd4818490e72ff662dca5cb
Closes-Bug: #1737500

commit_message:
Streamline published release notes

reno isn't really doing stable branches anymore, but its release notes
are set up like it is. Remove 'mainline' title from the primary section.
Then update the 'Newton Series' title to 'Newton and Earlier' to
indicate it's not just capturing Newton itself, but really everything
before 2.0.

Change-Id: Idbc70e270b1a70ffdee1da843cdc234164df05d2

[{'created': '2018-04-14 15:32:40.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/releasenotes/index.rst'], 'message': "Collapse Unreleased and Mainline sections

The current release notes produced have an 'Unreleased' section that
includes the releases back through 2.0.0, then mainline that includes
those release notes as well as 1.5.0 through 0.1.0.

Squish the two so that there is just one copy of each of them. Remove
the explicit mention of origin/master and the earliest-version and just
let the normal reno logic apply.

Change-Id: I02bb2c69b8dd9e866e4efa3437e9c09c33488914
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Collapse Unreleased and Mainline sections

The current release notes produced have an 'Unreleased' section that
includes the releases back through 2.0.0, then mainline that includes
those release notes as well as 1.5.0 through 0.1.0.

Squish the two so that there is just one copy of each of them. Remove
the explicit mention of origin/master and the earliest-version and just
let the normal reno logic apply.

Change-Id: I02bb2c69b8dd9e866e4efa3437e9c09c33488914

[{'created': '2018-03-20 20:23:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'DNM: EXPERIMENTAL: Set proc_units_factor to 0.1 in VMBuilder init

In-tree PowerVM CI runs are sometimes failing to create lpars because
there are not enough available processor units. This issue is not
hitting out-of-tree CI runs. OOT CI runs use the nova-powervm conf
default of 0.1 for proc_units_factor while IT CI runs use the pypowervm
default of 0.5. This is an experimental patch that will hardcode
proc_units_factor to 0.1 IT to determine if the different value IT is
the source of the IT CI failures.

Change-Id: I67bfe2a6eff86f1947ada7661fc7c3fed81ed28f
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-03-26 15:57:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'PowerVM: Add proc_units_factor conf option

the number of processor units to assign per vCPU.

commit_message:
PowerVM: Add proc_units_factor conf option

This introduces a new PowerVM conf option, proc_units_factor, which can
range from 0.05 to 1.0 and will default to 0.1. It is used to calculate
the physical processing power to assign per vCPU, where 1.0 is a whole
physical processor and 0.05 is 1/20th of a physical processor.

Change-Id: I67bfe2a6eff86f1947ada7661fc7c3fed81ed28f

commit_message:
Consult the dictionary for root provider ids

For readability, this patch refactors the code getting allocation
candidates. This patch changes _get_providers_with_nested_capacity
to return a simple list of rp_ids rather than a list of tuples,
(rp_ids, root_ids).

Instead, we use the dictionary keyed by rp_ids, "rp_ref_dict".

Change-Id: Ie53c96508da7f74cfa5ded3eec0a069fec276b5d

commit_message:
Improve getting nested providers with capacity

Getting allocation candidates, we at first got all the possible nested
providers with enough resource capacity. But when we know which root
providers can satisfy the request in advance, we should do this in a
more effective way getting only providers that are descendents of
those root providers.

This patch changes _get_providers_with_nested_capacity to accept
root provider ids for its arguments and filter return values to have
only descendents of the root providers.

Change-Id: If833e08bab0ca68764798f72b948384a3fbb6f8a

This commit implements reverting volume to a snapshot when
backend_storage is ceph

commit_message:
DNM: Add instance AZ filter for nova instances

The option `cross_az_attach` in nova gives the possibility
to disable cross az attachment of volume on nova vms.
What is missing is a cinder scheduler filter that uses the
instance AZ and filters the corresponding cinder AZs.

WiP / DO NOT MERGE

Change-Id: I3028dbdf08e9f0f815fdcd1796a23def6f328943

commit_message:
Add volume existence check when we backup it

I think it has already completed the validation
check for container name. So I only add volume
existence check.

Change-Id: I2dce4e60a7b8f29b3c0498cb88c27d2793974a16

commit_message:
Adds snapshot based backups for Quobyte volumes

Adds local management of snapshot based backups similar to the lvm
implementation (code is based on this).
As Quobyte based Cinder volumes are files in a
shared Quobyte volume the driver can access the snapshots locally
similar to the lvm setup.
Also adds a corresponding unit test and a release note.

Implements: blueprint quobyte-snapshot-backup

Change-Id: I465a908d754cba9f9982a3224c9b86449fc69865

Currently, self.db.snapshot_update is used to update the snapshot info

Closes-Bug: #1599022
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix snapshot update exception while creating cgsnapshot

Currently, self.db.snapshot_update is used to update the snapshot info
while creating cgsnapshot, but Snapshot object should be used instead.

Change-Id: Iaa801876b76d54fe3aa49f43b189ddee28963d14
Closes-Bug: #1599022

which should be in sync to avoid deadlock errors.

commit_message:
3PAR: concurrent request creates multiple issues

When a user wants to perform parallel cinder image volume
creation operation, 3par driver ends the execution up with
different errors in different test scenarios as described
in bug.

While creating image volumes concurrently on HPE 3PAR, one of the
step is to copy image to volume. And for this copy process, 3par
driver tries to establish connection between host and array. As
the volume creation requests are multiple and concurrent, multiple
requests are being issued for connection between host and array
which should be in sync to avoid deadlock errors.

Closes-Bug: #1658888

Change-Id: I6535ec139e09062248060f4692a721a352c091eb

commit_message:
Huawei: support for ipv6

Both ipv4 and ipv6 are supported by Huawei cinder driver when attaching
a volume to a VM.

Change-Id: I6fe6c2b226d3863c7eb91e76120d98a6230e0f42
Implements: blueprint ipv6-support

commit_message:
Fix storage pools key of Huawei driver

Storage pools key is incorrect while getting local/remote device of
Huawei driver, this patch changes it to the correct one.

Change-Id: Ic48c5a0ddfbec4b86e6dc62ad7d4b1a86db86f1c
Closes-Bug: #1635500

[{'created': '2017-06-11 06:17:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Converting string into JSON when cinder takes block_device_mapping value from DB

To reproduce this bug:
1. Boot an instance from a volume.
2. Create an image of this volume-backended instance using nova image-create.
3. Create a new volume using this image.
4. Boot a new instance using this newly created volume.
    -> then booting an instacne fails with the error message below
Invalid image metadata. Error: A list is required in field img_block_device_mapping, not a unicode (HTTP 400)

The cause of this bug is, when creating an image meta object, Cinder passes block_device_mapping value as string to Nova
but the value should be json.

Change-Id: I6c70f61cc9fc9abc23a36cf33df2e4fc0273bcd4

commit_message:
Converting string into JSON when cinder takes block_device_mapping value from DB

To reproduce this bug:
1. Boot an instance from a volume.
2. Create an image of this volume-backended instance using nova image-create.
3. Create a new volume using this image.
4. Boot a new instance using this newly created volume.
    -> then booting an instacne fails with the error message below
Invalid image metadata. Error: A list is required in field img_block_device_mapping, not a unicode (HTTP 400)

The cause of this bug is, when creating an image meta object, Cinder passes block_device_mapping value as string to Nova
but the value should be json.

Closes-Bug: #1476114
Change-Id: I6c70f61cc9fc9abc23a36cf33df2e4fc0273bcd4

commit_message:
Remove unused function _build_iscsi_target_name

This function is not used anywhere in the code.
With this function removed, there is no need for a
body for SanISCSIDriver.

Change-Id: Icea18ea98de980ba57d278c2e9512dcfb14ca425

commit_message:
db/sqlalchemy/api: delete in_use value

When the first consistencygroup is created for a new project in
cinder, reserved value can assign to in_use. Thereforce, in_use
value shouldn't be updated.

Change-Id: I77b760655f71e61fd9c299de2da3703f88872293
close-bug: 1693610

commit_message:
Enhance Infortrend driver

Features added:
- Protocol iSCSI supports both MPIO and MCS now.
- Improve Infortrend driver performance.
- Enhance extraspecs usage and refactor retype.
- Support for list manageable volume
- Support for list/manage/unmanage snapshot

Issues fixed:
- Errors for live migration with Infortrend backend.(#1481968)
- Manage-existing issues for using source-name.
- Creating volume on a wrong pool.

Co-Authored-By: billsung <billsung.taiwan@gmail.com>

Closes-bug: #1481968
Change-Id: I6e9d4c9e4637bf2a5e745f1b02006d5cc898807e

commit_message:
vzstorage: deprecate vzstorage_mount_options

These mount options has never passed to pstorage-mount.
Instead of that mount options should be defined in
shares config file.

Change-Id: Ibadcc88d228c8fd1862db8379f3646f393e7362a
Signed-off-by: Pavel Glushchak <pglushchak@virtuozzo.com>

commit_message:
Support utf-8 decode

The decode format is not designed in wsgi _process_stack function,
which will cause exception when create volume with Chinese character.
This patch is to fix it.

Change-Id: I8030a83129810baf4b3a1e420152cf81e75ad0a0
Closes-Bug: #1703493

[{'created': '2017-04-12 06:31:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Support shared lock

Currently we protects create from volume/snapshot by using a
lock to protect the operation from concurrent deletes the
volumes/snapshot used in the create operation, but we use
exclusive locks on both delete and create side which will result
in only one create operations from the same volume/sanpshot can
process on the same time.

Since Tooz has supported shared filelock, this patch gives a
optimized method, add exclusive(write) locks for delete
operations and shared(read) locks for create operations, so we
can create from volume/sanpshot on parallel and also protect
create operations from concurrent delete the source
volume/snapshot.

Change-Id: I78200911dac2a50d3375de63a4318077b276b0fd

commit_message:
Support shared lock

Currently we protects create from volume/snapshot by using a
lock to protect the operation from concurrent deletes the
volumes/snapshot used in the create operation, but we use
exclusive locks on both delete and create side which will result
in only one create operations from the same volume/snapshot can
process on the same time.

Since Tooz has supported shared filelock, this patch gives a
optimized method, add exclusive(write) locks for delete
operations and shared(read) locks for create operations, so we
can create from volume/snapshot on parallel and also protect
create operations from concurrent delete the source
volume/snapshot.

It add a 'concurrent_create' config option because some arrays
don't support creating a couple of volumes from the same
volume/snapshot.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I78200911dac2a50d3375de63a4318077b276b0fd

This fix allows an openstack user to create more than 1 resource with same
display names. As CoprHD currently has no support for this, we append a
unique ID to the display name before sending the request to CoprHD.

Logic has been added to append the Openstack Volume ID with the volume
name, this volume ID will only be appended to the volume name in CoprHD.

commit_message:
CoprHD: Handle duplicate display naming error

This fix allows an openstack user to create more than 1 resource with same
display names. As CoprHD currently has no support for this, we append a
unique ID to the display name before sending the request to CoprHD.

Logic has been added to append the Openstack Volume ID with the volume
name, this volume ID will only be appended to the volume name in CoprHD.
In Openstack the display name will be shown as provided by the user.

Change-Id: Ie0df89a84a8135851c35825c26ffce600e855843
Closes-Bug: #1653634

commit_message:
make incremental effective when cinder-backup create

An incremental column is added to backups table and it's
default value is false, then 'incremental' can be used
in backup.drivers.ceph.CephBackupDriver.backup. When
volume is rbd and incremental is true, attempt incremental
backup.

Change-Id: I9fe912a4aeb4d5ff8a648800c91943c423323514
Close-bug: #1578036

commit_message:
Nosec verify=False until driver writer review

In an effort to clean up Cinder's Bandit run, issue B501 (Requests call
with verify=False disabling SSL certificate checks) from Bandit
has been nosec'd until the driver implementers are able to implement
this security feature. We decided against blacklisting the Bandit issue
so that future code writers will carefully consider enabling this
security measure.

Change-Id: If88335041807a450849e39e416ec01566c3dde0d

commit_message:
Increase existence check for image when create volumes

Obviously, there have some existence check for volumes and snapshot.
However, there has not a existence check for image if we create a
volume from a image. And there must be have some exceptions if image
has been deleted when we create a volume. So this patch is aim to add
a check for image, and avoid to produce such exceptions.

Change-Id: Iaaf2ba7d2d9e52fd5102c31d38f00f2d1602bf4e
Closed-Bug #1644397

commit_message:
Integrate oslo.config validator

Adds the oslo configuration file validator as a new entry point.

The config validator is a tool intended for use by operators to validate
their modified configuration files before standing up services in production.

Change-Id: Iea7f5408ecaf9750cf13a9a7c20472c01f84d280
Depends-On: I78d3621afda226f5968963ef408507234dfead4c

commit_message:
Update wording in @safe_connect placement warnings

We're well past the point of Placement being required,
so this drops the wording about Newton and Ocata and
just makes the warnings say that Placement is required.

Change-Id: I42730e6ef0ac66efe9122ac3078ca15c1071b080

commit_message:
get error information while choosing next page on dashboard

There have been 5 volumes exsit, and 2 volumes per page.
After deleting the second volume in second page,  I get the error
information "Unable to retrieve list of volumes." on dashboard.
cinder should catch the exception when marker is deleted volume.

Change-Id: I9792c05685b3fc6820c75ceea4117eac6cec60a7
Close-Bug: #1672649

commit_message:
Volume replication support in GPFS driver

GPFS supports data mirroring and replication for high availability
of data. More information can be found at https://ibm.biz/Bdr7kd.
This patch adds the support of replication in GPFS driver by exposing
the underlying capability to the scheduler.

DocImpact
Needs an update in GPFS driver documentation, as this patch introduces
replication support for the GPFS backend.

Change-Id: I776fcb1a29b1b225dd81ead18ab45ab0241c518b

commit_message:
Support FICON-attached ECKD volumes on System z

FICON (Fibre Connection) is a Fibre-Channel FC-4 layer protocol. It is
used on mainframes to attach ECKD volumes via Fibre-Channel. While FICON
shares a common transport protocol with FCP, there are several
differences. ECKD volumes are addressed by a Control Unit and Unit
Address, rather than a LUN. Besides, different commands are required in
order to attach an ECKD volume to a hypervisor.

Implements: blueprint linux-ficon-support
Change-Id: I1ba52d83907fd094be7c8480c5a5bf918876caa5

commit_message:
Tegile driver doesn't honor create from snapshot volume size

create_volume_from_snapshot can specify a volume size larger than
the original snapshot. Tegile driver doesn't appear to handle this size
difference. This patch fixes it.

Co-Authored-By: Xinli Guan <xinli@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: Id8cc82ec9d1565f7cbd38684f6d1a712cfba1cd6
Closes-Bug: #1560640

commit_message:
Allow volume migration between different availablity zones

Currently volume migration bewteen different availability zones does not
work. To solve this issue, the following procedue should be done:
1. Add a new configuration item 'enable_across_az_migrate'. If enabled
volume migration between different AZ's will be allowed. Otherwise, not
allowed.
2. Add two volume backend with same 'volume_backend_name'.
3. Allocated different AZ for different backend. After that, restart the
cinder volume service.
4. Migrate volume to the different AZ.

Closes-Bug: #1550353

in context.

Format attachment-update details for spacing.

commit_message:
Update 'update' queries for transfers table

A new column 'revision_number' is added  to the 'transfers' table
and queries which update this table need to need to be modified to
account for this change.

Implements: blueprint ha-db-object-version-counter
Co-Authored-By: Szymon Wroblewski <szymon.wroblewski@intel.com>

Change-Id: Ide12db59f368a29606a18fa22f84cb88f2965f77

A new column 'revision_number' is added to the 'transfers' table

Implements: blueprint ha-db-object-version-counter
Co-Authored-By: Szymon Wroblewski <szymon.wroblewski@intel.com>

Instead of assertTrue and assertFalse use more specific asserts.
They are compatible with Python 2.7[1] and 3.4[2]

[1]: https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/unittest.html
[2]: https://docs.python.org/3.4/library/unittest.html

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-02-14 16:56:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Use more specific asserts in tests

commit_message:
Use more specific asserts in tests

Instead of assertEqual(False, A) and assertEqual(True, A)
use assertFalse(A) and assertTrue(A).
They are compatible with Python 3.5[1]

[1]: https://docs.python.org/3.5/library/unittest.html

Change-Id: I0a7b11044b9968de9d9402c1a35b28374487b16c

commit_message:
FalconStor: Support generic group

Add CG capability to Groups.

Change-Id: Ifb298ba827cc575695eec1f629108f53c08b66d0
Closes-Bug: #1682248
Implements: blueprint falconstor-generic-group

commit_message:
HPE3PAR: Retype replication volume with provisioning

3PAR cannot change provisioning of replicated
volume, which has remote copy. so the workaround
is to stop the remote copy, change the
provisioning and then start remote copy.

Change-Id: I279f460a55b6bdf7c8f0689307291657e0504ca3
Closes-bug: 1714473

subject: update requirements to support matching global exclusions
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-10 18:12:51.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'update requirements to support matching global exclusions

The match for dependency names is case sensitive, so change
"pastedeploy" to "PasteDeploy".

The match for dependencies takes the environment markers into account,
so add a marker for dnspython to restrict its use to python 2.7. There
is a dnspython3 package for use with version 3, and that can be added
separately as part of the python 3 porting work.

Change-Id: Ia2bb2e1846d734609ea9ff37d2ad1ffd37ced950
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/560109
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
update requirements to support matching global exclusions

The match for dependency names is case sensitive, so change
"pastedeploy" to "PasteDeploy".

The match for dependencies takes the environment markers into account,
so add a marker for dnspython to restrict its use to python 2.7. There
is a dnspython3 package for use with version 3, and that can be added
separately as part of the python 3 porting work.

Change-Id: Ia2bb2e1846d734609ea9ff37d2ad1ffd37ced950
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/560109
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Remove the need for OpenStackConfig in CloudRegion
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-23 15:55:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Remove the need for OpenStackConfig in CloudRegion

There are a few things in CloudRegion that require calling back out to
the creating OpenStackConfig object. However, now that creating a
CloudRegion directly is a thing, those calls have become more awkward.

Shift the cache settings and methods to CloudRegion along with the
extra_config logic. Move two of the utility methods in loader into a
_util file so that both loader and cloud_region can import it. This
renames get_cache_expiration to get_cache_expirations, but I'm fairly
confident that the only consumer of get_cache_expirations here is
openstack.cloud.

Change-Id: Ia6ed0f00bfc2483bd09169811198cdf1a0ab2f15
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-03-29 16:06:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Remove the need for OpenStackConfig in CloudRegion

There are a few things in CloudRegion that require calling back out to
the creating OpenStackConfig object. However, now that creating a
CloudRegion directly is a thing, those calls have become more awkward.

Shift the cache settings and methods to CloudRegion along with the
extra_config logic. Move two of the utility methods in loader into a
_util file so that both loader and cloud_region can import it. This
renames get_cache_expiration to get_cache_expirations, but I'm fairly
confident that the only consumer of get_cache_expirations here is
openstack.cloud.

Leave passing in the OpenStackConfig for now, because osc uses it.
However, if we can get osc shifted to using get_password_callback, we
can get rid of it.

Change-Id: Ia6ed0f00bfc2483bd09169811198cdf1a0ab2f15
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2018-03-29 17:16:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Remove the need for OpenStackConfig in CloudRegion

Shift the cache settings and methods to CloudRegion along with the

renames get_cache_expiration to get_cache_expirations, but I'm fairly
confident that the only consumer of get_cache_expirations here is
openstack.cloud.

Leave passing in the OpenStackConfig for now, because osc uses it.
However, if we can get osc shifted to using get_password_callback, we
can get rid of it.

commit_message:
Remove the need for OpenStackConfig in CloudRegion

There are a few things in CloudRegion that require calling back out to
the creating OpenStackConfig object. However, now that creating a
CloudRegion directly is a thing, those calls have become more awkward.

Shift the cache settings and methods to CloudRegion along with the
extra_config logic. Move two of the utility methods in loader into a
_util file so that both loader and cloud_region can import it. This
renames get_cache_expiration to get_cache_expirations, but I'm fairly
confident that the only consumer of get_cache_expirations here is
openstack.cloud.

Leave passing in the OpenStackConfig for now, because osc uses it.
However, if we can get osc shifted to using get_password_callback, we
can get rid of it.

Change-Id: Ia6ed0f00bfc2483bd09169811198cdf1a0ab2f15

commit_message:
Add variables to connect ELK and Grafana

With the option to deploy grafana the following changes allow a user to
automatically connect ELK and Grafana.

Change-Id: Ic8e64a31d860940c6863f46ce558908d5ef8f8e7
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add tags fields for server list detail/show api-ref

As of the 2.26 microversion, the 'tags' field is in the response for
showing details about a given server, but the tags field is not in
the response table description for that API.

This patch added tags field for server list detail and show API.

Co-Authored-By: Artom Lifshitz <alifshit@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Idef667d7c8b1cd4781ccd391a481af3d46113f4e
Closes-Bug: #1673628

commit_message:
use sub-resource API extension support

Now that neutron-lib supports sub-resources [1], there's no need for
extension classes to override update_attributes_map and
get_extended_resources to add their own sub-resources. This patch
removes those methods from the qos extensions class.

NeutronLibImpact

[1] I8ae11633962a48de6e8559b85447b8c8c753d705

Change-Id: Ibb66246091fd84e18c56009f5fcb8fdea3aff6b7

commit_message:
Add autoescape parameter to jinja env

We create enviroment object and use that to load templates, but this
templates can be changed by user. This can lead to security problems.

Change-Id: I294f49c15d0d7987870c077438af291a6ac6816f

commit_message:
Dell EMC SC: volume model update return missing vol id

Create_group_from_src is not returning the volume id along with
the other volume updates. Manager.py uses this to update the db.

Added this id to create_group_from_src return.

Closes-Bug: #1759897
Change-Id: I240df78363182e4e8017f89b67c0f7d7bf6819c8
(cherry picked from commit 430a292b836cde4386c88f467a016ee17fef40eb)

commit_message:
V3 jsonschema validation: volume actions

This patch adds jsonschema validation for below volume actions API's
* POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action (attach)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action (detach)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action (volume_upload_image)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action (extend)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action (retype)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action (initialize_connection)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action (terminate_connection)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action (set_bootable_status)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action (update_readonly_flag)

Change-Id: I39ede009d5e909a076860df7305865286caa5352
Partial-Implements: bp json-schema-validation

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Additionally:
* add funcsigs to lower-constraints.txt
* set lower-constraint for sphinx=1.6.2

Change-Id: Ia9d795125a00d4bbe6d52738f0d8dc286ed4c676

commit_message:
Expose shutdown retry interval as config setting

This option is in the driver interface but was hard coded in the manager
class.

Defaults to old value (10 seconds) if not set in configuration file.

Change-Id: I0c8db2efec6098c017aad2f6588938bc548db139

commit_message:
Catch exceptions when updating service

service_manage_report is periodically called by the engine service
timer.  If an exception occurs during the execution of
service_manage_report, the timer is killed.  This leaves the engine
service to believe it is dead.

With this change any exceptions encountered during service update will
be caught and logged without killing the timer.

The same exception handling is added to service_manage_cleanup.

Closes-Bug: #1763490

Change-Id: Id1ba7f9c815cfebe2b2d269640a6544ababd7ae8

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-03-27 04:10:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py', 'nova/conductor/manager.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': "Add host to API and Conductor

commit_message:
Add host to API and Conductor

The instance action event is recorded in API/Conductor/Compute using
EventReporter, in order to help admins to find the host of events
occurring we also need pass the host info to EventReporter.

In compute, we already have a self.host on the
nova.compute.manager.ComputeManager, but API/Conductor doesn't contain
this.

In order to get host conveniently, this patch add host to API and
Conductor, and set it to CONF.host when api and conductor initialize.

Part of blueprint: add-host-to-instance-action-events

Change-Id: Idf57fb5fbc611abb83943bd7e36d3cebf03b3977

commit_message:
Removes odl-dlux-gui feature for ODL

The GUI feature is no longer supported with ODL and needs to be removed.
We relied on the URL provided by this feature in order to run our docker
healtcheck, which is modified in the depends-on patch to a new URI.

Depends-On: I2f33d2cf6a96005ef1d18468a8d2fcc71b17b6f8

Related-Bug: 1751857

Change-Id: I762789e65913b4f653bbf9019b5d3d05903912f1
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit f51f5336798751d9a23b69c4c301f748251a6064)

commit_message:
Fixes ODL healthcheck URI

In the past we used index.html to ensure ODL container was healthy.
This page was provided by the GUI plugins into ODL.  Now that those
plugins are no longer supported, we need to move to a more reliable URI
path.

Related-Bug: 1751857

Change-Id: I2f33d2cf6a96005ef1d18468a8d2fcc71b17b6f8
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9e72a429d1ae1d6be2e747a973be6b6c072cd630)

commit_message:
Change permissions on SSL keys to 640

This tightens up the security on the SSL keys stored in
/etc/apache2/ssl/<service> to be no longer world readable.

This is a backport from master:
cherry-pick: 6470d6dd2c261a74c128004ad1a75e6f134b6691

Change-Id: I5c6349d421f9ee0627dc95797291a466dee7fe37
Related-Bug: #1761305

commit_message:
[placement] Filter allocation candidates by forbidden traits in db

Adjust the generated SQL and surrounding python code to support
expressing forbidden traits when requesting allocation candidates.
Any resource provider which has a forbidden trait will not be
included.

The RequestGroup object now supports a forbidden_traits attribute.
Code in forthcoming patches will adjust the query string processing
that creates a RequestGroup to set that attribute if the calling code
is using the right microversion.

Partially implements blueprint placement-forbidden-traits
Change-Id: I53f6fce0810c53551710407df7ab1689282e73f3

subject: Fix ports_per_network bug in create port
revisions:

ports_per_network means the number of ports for one network.
However, in some test cases, the number of ports for one network
is more than ports_per_network.
This patch fix this.

Change-Id: If03b345e5643081da3d546e42eade5cae474b1ea
Close-bug: #1664153
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix ports_per_network bug in create port

ports_per_network means the number of ports for one network.
However, in some test cases, the number of ports for one network
is more than ports_per_network.
This patch fix this.

Change-Id: If03b345e5643081da3d546e42eade5cae474b1ea
Close-bug: #1664153

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-26 10:03:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "[placement] Filter resource providers by forbidden traits in db

This is the db-side work for filtering resource providers by
forbidden traits. If allow_forbidden is True, then traits
with a prefix of '!' are treated as a trait that must not be
present on the resource providers being considered for the results.

This is done using a boolean argument to the get_by_filters call so
we can control the functionality from a microversion in the
list_resource_providers handler and implement the functionality
before the microversion is ready (beause we want to implement the
functionality in /allocation_candidates in the same microversion).
Code for all that is coming in subsequent patches.

TODO: functional tests

Partially implements blueprint placement-forbidden-traits
Change-Id: I46796d49931df20b002d1a7e6bb3a6be34dabefa

commit_message:
[placement] Filter resource providers by forbidden traits in db

This is the db-side work for filtering resource providers by
forbidden traits. Since we control whether forbidden is allowed
or not at the API layer, we can add support here in the DB layer
such that it works all the time.

Subsequent patches will turn on the the functionality in a microversion.

Partially implements blueprint placement-forbidden-traits
Change-Id: I46796d49931df20b002d1a7e6bb3a6be34dabefa

commit_message:
[placement] Parse forbidden traits in query strings

Add support to parse_qs_request_groups to optionally process the
"required" parameter for forbidden traits, expressed as the
normal trait form prefixed with "!". The parsing removes "!"
prefixed traits from the required_traits attribute on a
RequestGroup and puts them (without the "!") in a new
forbidden_traits attribute.

The optionality allows the caller to control the processing
based on the microversion. Later code will add that to
the list resource providers and list allocation canidates
handler code, in the same microversion.

This allows declaring forbidden handling only at the API layer.
Subsequent patches will turn on forbidden handling in the object/
data layer but no forbidden traits will reach that layer until
the microversion turns on allow_forbidden in the API.

Partially implements blueprint placement-forbidden-traits
Change-Id: Icc9dc2631a0eca9e998b9ce8706c7b6920e0cb69

commit_message:
Allow cascade deletion of load balancer

According to the v2 api reference:
https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/load-balancer/v2/#remove-a-load-balancer
The optional parameter cascade when defined as true will delete all
child objects of the load balancer.

Change-Id: I3290eeae6c11fc9c42bffc19ccac9c8375932f1e

commit_message:
use rpc Connection rather than create_connection

The create_connection function in neutron.common.rpc is just an alias to
Connection. This patch switches to the later so we can remove the former
in: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560130

Change-Id: I623691146fb1ee85a00a1d507ea5ffef84ae52d1

commit_message:
Partially revert "Remove mox in unit/virt/xenapi/test_vm_utils.py (3)"

Mox stubs in test_vm_utils.py was replaced with mock in
I138657464aecf6712804a87f102a430c242d85a4.
But the test_non_ami method of the StreamDiskTestCase class
intermittently failed in the gate jobs.
See https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1763535 for more details.

So the modification in the StreamDiskTestCase class
is reverted temporarily.

Change-Id: I77909d7d2a0f601d4a6f0b899259dd6816c74f35
Related-Bug: #1763535
Implements: blueprint mox-removal

commit_message:
Sync xenapi and libvirt on what flags to pass e2fsck.

I can't see a good reason for the two drivers to use different
flags, and this simplifies the code a little.

Change-Id: I55cdc22ce8f95dff0cfd1a31b58582fc4b3ea48f
blueprint: hurrah-for-privsep-again

commit_message:
Remove nat/masquerading config workarounds.

1) This reverts commit e47d68eb11d3c2a1360c9018b6a47f05e874ecbc.
   That was technical debt, and with the new service in THT we don't need
   it anymore in Rocky.

2) This removes undercloud_external_network_cidr rule that shouldn't be
   useful since we control in THT for Rocky.

Closes-Bug: #1756183
Change-Id: I39b04f81803d76e419d1f3960edc4c927b2dbd4e

subject: Allow port security to be disabled
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-29 20:50:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Allow port security to be disabled

Allow Murano application packages to specify whether port security
should be disabled for a network.  By default, the Heat service
will enable port security for all ports in a network.  With this
change, Murano will now propagate to Heat the application's
desire to disable port security if the application sets a new
flag, port_security_enabled, to false in the Neutron network object.

Change-Id: Iab25b4901010c24aef42213a7a9082b7594a5a16
Closes-Bug: 1759914
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-04-11 13:27:58.000000000', 'files': ['meta/io.murano/Classes/resources/NeutronNetworkBase.yaml'], 'message': "Allow port security to be disabled

Allow Murano application packages to specify whether port security
should be disabled for a network.  With this change, Murano will now
propagate to Heat the application's desire to disable port security
if the application sets a new flag, port_security_disable, to true
in the Neutron network object.

Change-Id: Iab25b4901010c24aef42213a7a9082b7594a5a16
Closes-Bug: 1759914
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Allow port security to be disabled

Allow Murano application packages to specify whether port security
should be disabled for a network.  With this change, Murano will now
propagate to Heat the application's desire to disable port security
if the application sets a new flag, port_security_disable, to true
in the Neutron network object.

Change-Id: Iab25b4901010c24aef42213a7a9082b7594a5a16
Closes-Bug: 1759914

commit_message:
Simplify init-runonce boot command

openstack cli now supports --network foo rather than having to find the
network uuid. Thanks to mgoddard for the tip.

Change-Id: I9ce94a86c6950b81ef3ec70fe10ee565cc1f1171

set default python to python3

Set the default python to python3 except for the py27 environment. We
have to set that explicitly to override the new default.

Change-Id: I2ac4c36cf0d3786da9bb35abf28c039da7b8aa1e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

[{'created': '2018-04-11 14:41:59.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/eseries/fc_driver.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/eseries/iscsi_driver.py'], 'message': 'NetApp E-Series: Fix broken generic volume groups

The Generic Volume Groups functionality is currently broken in the
E-Series driver because it is not defining/removing a back-end
consistency group when creating/deleting a generic group.

This patch adds an implementation method in the respective E-Series
drivers to utilize the underlying CG functionality.

Closes-Bug: #1706777
Change-Id: I55dc417060d9226c2f120a16b031a79839d483d3
(cherry picked from commit 443dfd9d8c464ba18d2fcd5c3b3fc10602923fde)

commit_message:
NetApp E-Series: Fix broken generic volume groups

The Generic Volume Groups functionality is currently broken in the
E-Series driver because it is not defining/removing a back-end
consistency group when creating/deleting a generic group.

This patch adds an implementation method in the respective E-Series
drivers to utilize the underlying CG functionality.

Closes-Bug: #1706777
Change-Id: I55dc417060d9226c2f120a16b031a79839d483d3
(cherry picked from commit 443dfd9d8c464ba18d2fcd5c3b3fc10602923fde)

thread starting at

for more details.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-22 08:24:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Follow the new PTI for document build

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:

commit_message:
Follow the new PTI for document build

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

Remove the '[build_sphinx]' and [pbr] sections as described in:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128594.html

Adds the use of sphinxcontrib.apidoc to get (mostly) the same output as what
was provided by the removed [pbr] section.

Change-Id: Ie7e3acef7161cb8f218c2333167490c8116a2122
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560270/

because the libvirt host_uuid missing, when run live migration,
nova will get the host uuid, if all host uuid is the same value,
the action will failed because nova think it attempt to migrate
guest to the same host.

Change-Id: Ib8c8e9243bb01117e8863801f834cfd4c78089ab
Closes-Bug: #1745557
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix live migration failed because the host_uuid missing

because the libvirt host_uuid missing, when run live migration,
nova will get the host uuid, if all host uuid is the same value,
the action will failed because nova think it attempt to migrate
guest to the same host.

Change-Id: Ib8c8e9243bb01117e8863801f834cfd4c78089ab
Closes-Bug: #1745557

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-13 00:08:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Updates jobs running on the election repo

Currently we run the requirements-check job on the election repo which
isn't really helpful as these tools don't really need to be
co-installable with OpenStack services.

We're also *not* running any kind of linter so we have a few code
style issues creeping in.

This removes requirements-check and adds a non-voting linter to the
check pipeline.  We can upgrade the latter to voting once all issues
are fixed, which wont be during the current TC election.

Change-Id: Id2ad76b587ef50104d6410c8d6c497bf291ed662

isn't really helpful as these tools don't really need to be
co-installable with OpenStack services.

We're also *not* running any kind of linter so we have a few code
style issues creeping in.

This removes requirements-check and adds a non-voting linter to the

Change-Id: Id2ad76b587ef50104d6410c8d6c497bf291ed662
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Updates jobs running on the election repo

Currently we run the requirements-check job on the election repo which
isn't really helpful as these tools don't really need to be
co-installable with OpenStack services.

We're also *not* running any kind of linter so we have a few code
style issues creeping in.

This removes requirements-check and adds a non-voting linter to the
check pipeline.  We can upgrade the latter to voting once all issues
are fixed, which wont be during the current TC election.

Change-Id: Id2ad76b587ef50104d6410c8d6c497bf291ed662

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 15:00:52.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'message': "Remove the branch specifier from the nova-multiattach job

For in-tree job definitions, the job is branch-specific
by design, so we don't need the stable branch exclusion
specifier as it won't run on those branches anyway since
it's not defined for those branches.

Related to https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2001839
Related-Bug: #1763382

Change-Id: I78dead482e2ed8262745cb08c9f4ab71035adb33
(cherry picked from commit 406c9d13db80d05f6668c2eee3eae867fd91ceb9)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove the branch specifier from the nova-multiattach job

For in-tree job definitions, the job is branch-specific
by design, so we don't need the stable branch exclusion
specifier as it won't run on those branches anyway since
it's not defined for those branches.

Related to https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2001839
Related-Bug: #1763382

Change-Id: I78dead482e2ed8262745cb08c9f4ab71035adb33
(cherry picked from commit 406c9d13db80d05f6668c2eee3eae867fd91ceb9)

commit_message:
Add grafana

This change introduces grafana into the stack which gives us a great
way to visualize the data. The grafana role from cloudalchemy is being
used for the bulk of the deployment.

Because the grafana deployment playbook is now standalone the mentions
of grafana in the other ops directories have been removed.

Change-Id: I23e1c96cd1fda7ece9b86a69f9f0326913de714d
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
featureset20 requires larger instances

In order to execute a full run of tempest
in the time alloted to tripleo-ci jobs in
rdo software factory more cpu and memory
is required.
If featureset020, then use m1.ci.xlarge
vs m1.ci.large

Related-Bug: #1758932
Change-Id: I7a38a70f9a5c3199be095c94bb1753f6d026c5a4

commit_message:
Ensure we do not pass invalid data for A records

DNSPython does not allow IPs to have leading zeros
for A records [1] and eventlet agrees [2], so we should
ensure we do not create a situation where a project can
DOS itself.

This patch uses the DNSPython method to ensure it is kept in sync

1 - https://github.com/rthalley/dnspython/blob/v1.15.0/dns/ipv4.py#L52-L54
2 - https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/blob/v0.20.0/eventlet/support/dns/ipv4.py#L52-L54

Partial-Bug: 1760833
Change-Id: I975b18d390647de9fe11c105cd421b761f88be6c

commit_message:
set default python to python3

Set the default python to python3 except for the py27 environment. We
have to set that explicitly to override the new default.

Change-Id: I64799bb18c6c5848d23378e163481ad0fe1eea2b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
remove debtcollector from requirements

Once we clean-up our debt with the patches under this one, there's no
need for the debtcollector in neutron-lib.

This patch removes debtcollector from our requirements and lower
constraints.

Change-Id: I6161fe44fb6f7cb2271620235bd87fe80ce26127

commit_message:
use rpc Connection rather than create_connection

The create_connection function in neutron.common.rpc is just an alias to
Connection. This patch switches to the later so we can remove the former
in: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560130

Change-Id: I3ebb94c00becfb2d468470260a99ac2741a7ee81

commit_message:
Move MV history under API Microversion contrib docs

The REST API Version History was being listed in the top level
TOC for the contributor guide, causing each microversion to show
up as a separate item in the table of contents. This looks a odd
and causes a lot of scrolling to get to some of the contributor
information.

This moves the version history under the API Microversions
section so all microversion information is within on section of
the guide.

Change-Id: I74232b52088a395b618e07902427889200c2fdae

commit_message:
pep8: include no-tls-endpoints-public-ip.yaml in validation

no-tls-endpoints-public-ip.yaml is a new file that needs to be validated
among other TLS environments, so we can make sure that EndpointMap will
be constructed correctly with all needed endpoints.

Change-Id: I5e83b37d8fa757065a6dab87d6eeac1c345efd32

commit_message:
Skip service test

This commit makes service tests fail because an issue on kuryr
kubernetes when creating services using octavia without lbaasv2. [1]

This is a temporary measure to unlock the gates and will be reverted as
soon as the appropiate patches are merged [2]

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/kuryr-kubernetes/+bug/1763045
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560433/

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560946/
Change-Id: Idf55152b5f8ccc2133e272cdf9b9efd5e5ae64c9

commit_message:
WIP: Make placement-api run on uwsgi

Debian doesn't use Apache2, but has an init script using uwsgi
for nova-placement-api. This patch is an attempt to stop using
Apache, which binds on the same port.

Change-Id: I55e049d1483acbfd77adf81763e1048b2b036e51

commit_message:
WIP: Debian: make placement-api run on uwsgi

Debian doesn't use Apache2, but has an init script using uwsgi
for nova-placement-api. This patch is an attempt to stop using
Apache, which binds on the same port.

Change-Id: Iadc83d5fdf9e05ab281d5bc75cf812f390da2e2b

set default python to python3

Set the default python to python3 except for the py27 environment. We
have to set that explicitly to override the new default.

commit_message:
Update Duplicate entry exceptions to provide more information

This patchset updates the DuplicateEntry exception messages to
provide useful information about what exactly the duplicate values
are.  It also adds a test for duplicate workflows within a namespace,
and methods for testing assert error message contents.

Change-Id: I186e58e0d7c93d328070f32bd41c5ac79dcbda70
Closes-Bug: 1756443

commit_message:
Prometheus: Generate command line flags dynamically

This proposes a means for generating the command line flags for
configuring the Prometheus service via the values file instead of
templating out the command line flags used for the service. This
allows flexibility in choosing which flags and values to use when
deploying Prometheus, without needing to modify the chart itself

Change-Id: I74845b96e213403ad743724137a82ce2c78fcd1f

commit_message:
Fix bifrost CI

Bifrost's CI is broken by two items:

Ansible 2.5's pause module seems to be
more syntax strict, and we might have been
missing the pause logic all along due to the
when being down a level too far in the yaml.

Additionally, fedora core 26 support in CI
is no longer available, and as such disabling
for the time being.

This should fix CI.

Change-Id: I37df36d5f1bf13c833feda9e0a7f0a288a18a097

commit_message:
set default python to python3

Set the default python to python3 except for the py27 specific test
environments. Set Python 2.7 as the python version to use for these
tests.

Temporarily ignore optional driver requirements for now. This will be
addressed in a later update.

Change-Id: Iea8e48b72234bb9a580f2345396cf60fe2022618

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-11 14:17:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'lbaasv2: Fix for deployments missing the proxy

When Octavia stopped needing neutron-lbaasv2 devstack plugin we tried it
out with success but we still kept usage the plugin so that our devstack
plugin could target older than pike.

Unfortunately during this time the proxy became unnecessary and not well
maintained and due to our gates still using it, when we tried queens
with the supported proxy less Octavia we realized that it fails.

This patch addresses it by making the existing neutronclient usage point
to the load-balancer endpoint when the proxy is not in place.

Change-Id: Iafd74f23bdf336a4d78ba4759f702cf989c8bc30
Closes-Bug: #1763045
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

commit_message:
lbaasv2: Fix for deployments missing the proxy

When Octavia stopped needing neutron-lbaasv2 devstack plugin we tried it
out with success but we still kept usage the plugin so that our devstack
plugin could target older than pike.

Unfortunately during this time the proxy became unnecessary and not well
maintained and due to our gates still using it, when we tried queens
with the supported proxy less Octavia we realized that it fails.

This patch addresses it by making the existing neutronclient usage point
to the load-balancer endpoint when the proxy is not in place.

Change-Id: Iafd74f23bdf336a4d78ba4759f702cf989c8bc30
Closes-Bug: #1763045
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

commit_message:
Add missing Ubuntu packages

When running scripts/bootstrap-aio.sh with options set to
export BOOTSTRAP_OPTS="bootstrap_host_data_disk_device=sdb"
parted is required to cope with disk wiping and proper
partitioning. iptables are required later while configuring
vlans and bridges.

Change-Id: I2221fc63c3779358dec5edf9e2d110bc2e1528c1
(cherry picked from commit 83555059570cb5dd9d3f98e643dc04a823d5197b)

subject: Add resource-stickiness=INFINITY to VIPs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-13 06:51:51.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/pacemaker/haproxy_with_vip.pp'], 'message': 'Add resource-stickiness=INFINITY to VIPs

Right now we do not add any resource stickiness to the VIPs. This has
one consequence when we configure IHA: Namely, when a fenced compute
node comes back (i.e. it recovers), pacemaker is free to move the VIPs
around the controllers (see http://clusterlabs.org/pacemaker/doc/en-US/Pacemaker/1.1/html/Clusters_from_Scratch/_prevent_resources_from_moving_after_recovery.html)
to optimize the resource placement. We can observe the VIP moving with
the following message:
Apr 12 06:37:04 [979790] controller-1 pengine: notice: LogAction: * Move ip-10.0.0.110 ( controller-1 -> controller-0 )

This movement of the VIP is highly undesirable because in Instance HA the fence_compute agent needs to talk to keystone via the VIP, and if the VIP is on the move we might get the following errors:
Apr 12 06:37:23 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[259311] stderr: [ Starting new HTTP connection (1): 10.0.0.110 ]
Apr 12 06:37:23 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[259311] stderr: [ keystoneauth1.exceptions.connection.ConnectFailure: Unable to establish connection to http://10.0.0.110:5000 ]
Apr 12 06:37:28 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[261144] stderr: [ REQ: curl -g -i -X GET http://10.0.0.110:5000 -H "Accept: application/json" -H "User-Agent: python-keystoneclient" ]
Apr 12 06:37:28 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[261144] stderr: [ Starting new HTTP connection (1): 10.0.0.110 ]
Apr 12 06:37:28 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[261144] stderr: [ keystoneauth1.exceptions.connection.ConnectFailure: Unable to establish connection to http://10.0.0.110:5000 ]

By setting the resource-stickiness of the VIPs to INFINITY we control how strongly they prefer to stay running where they are.

Change-Id: I6862452d2250ac4c2c3e04840983510a3cd13536
Closes-Bug: #1763586
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add resource-stickiness=INFINITY to VIPs

Right now we do not add any resource stickiness to the VIPs. This has
one consequence when we configure IHA: Namely, when a fenced compute
node comes back (i.e. it recovers), pacemaker is free to move the VIPs
around the controllers (see http://clusterlabs.org/pacemaker/doc/en-US/Pacemaker/1.1/html/Clusters_from_Scratch/_prevent_resources_from_moving_after_recovery.html)
to optimize the resource placement. We can observe the VIP moving with
the following message:
Apr 12 06:37:04 [979790] controller-1 pengine: notice: LogAction: * Move ip-10.0.0.110 ( controller-1 -> controller-0 )

This movement of the VIP is highly undesirable because in Instance HA the fence_compute agent needs to talk to keystone via the VIP, and if the VIP is on the move we might get the following errors:
Apr 12 06:37:23 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[259311] stderr: [ Starting new HTTP connection (1): 10.0.0.110 ]
Apr 12 06:37:23 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[259311] stderr: [ keystoneauth1.exceptions.connection.ConnectFailure: Unable to establish connection to http://10.0.0.110:5000 ]
Apr 12 06:37:28 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[261144] stderr: [ REQ: curl -g -i -X GET http://10.0.0.110:5000 -H "Accept: application/json" -H "User-Agent: python-keystoneclient" ]
Apr 12 06:37:28 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[261144] stderr: [ Starting new HTTP connection (1): 10.0.0.110 ]
Apr 12 06:37:28 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[261144] stderr: [ keystoneauth1.exceptions.connection.ConnectFailure: Unable to establish connection to http://10.0.0.110:5000 ]

By setting the resource-stickiness of the VIPs to INFINITY we control how strongly they prefer to stay running where they are.

Change-Id: I6862452d2250ac4c2c3e04840983510a3cd13536
Closes-Bug: #1763586

commit_message:
Add host field to InstanceActionEvent

This patch adds the host field and obj_make_compatible with
InstanceActionEvent 1.2 version.

We record the event host info in event start method, and do
NOT record the host again in event finish method, because
it's the same event db record which is looked up by the
existing action(via request id) and event name from the
start event, the host of starting and ending is also same.

This would be used by instance action API to show the
``host`` information of the action event occurs.

Part of blueprint: add-host-to-instance-action-events

Change-Id: I356e7eb6b18837cf868bade7babaed96e5828688

Change-Id: I15972d9e8d473d2f85b32eb745f3768d92970d0a
', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2016-10-01 15:13:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Enables ironic list commands to use labels

Ironic list commands (such as node list, port list etc) did not take
resource label as input. After the fix, in addition to providing
resource.fields and resource.labels in the error message, it also
takes labels as input.

The problem was that resource_fields.py had a class called Resources
which only took field_ids as input. In the current fix, although it
still takes field_ids as input, but if a field label is provided as
input, it would also handle that and return tuple of field ids
using field label as input.

Closes-Bug:#1509191

Change-Id: I15972d9e8d473d2f85b32eb745f3768d92970d0a

commit_message:
Enables ironic list commands to use labels

Ironic list commands (such as node list, port list etc) did not take
resource label as input. After the fix, in addition to providing
resource.fields and resource.labels in the error message, it also
takes labels as input.

The problem was that resource_fields.py had a class called Resources
which only took field_ids as input. In the current fix, although it
still takes field_ids as input, but if a field label is provided as
input, it would also handle that and return tuple of field ids
using field label as input.

Closes-Bug:#1509191

Change-Id: I15972d9e8d473d2f85b32eb745f3768d92970d0a

commit_message:
libvirt: move version to string in utils

This will be used outside the libvirt driver itself in subsequent
patches, so this is factoring it out so it can be used elsewhere
instead of duplicating it.

Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I2e77d7ae3666a4ce9e256f7757b5d3c6ba2495dd

commit_message:
Remove the branch specifier from the nova-multiattach job

For in-tree job definitions, the job is branch-specific
by design, so we don't need the stable branch exclusion
specifier as it won't run on those branches anyway since
it's not defined for those branches.

Related to https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2001839
Related-Bug: #1763382

Change-Id: I78dead482e2ed8262745cb08c9f4ab71035adb33

commit_message:
only increment disk address unit for scsi devices

We were erroneously incrementing the disk address unit attribute for
non-scsi devices, which resulted in inconsistent disk device naming and
addresses when SCSI devices were used along with non-SCSI devices (like
configdrive devices).

Also, we ensure that we assign unit number 0 for the boot volume of a
boot-from-volume instance.

Change-Id: Ia91e2f9c316e25394a0f41dc341d903dfcff6921
Co-authored-by: Mehdi Abaakouk <sileht@sileht.net>
Closes-bug: #1729584
Closes-bug: #1753394

subject: Add RBAC tests for identity v3 project tags

This PS adds RBAC tests for the identity v3 project tags
API [0], whose policies can be found here: [1]. The

commit_message:
Add RBAC tests for identity v3 project tags

This PS adds RBAC tests for the identity v3 project tags
API [0], whose policies can be found here: [1]. The
corresponding Tempest client is implemented in [2].

[0] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/v3/index.html#project-tags
[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/19f9937e98473e4fab9f4ee5c86b23a2eaacfe0f/keystone/common/policies/project.py#L98-161
[2] Iec6b34c10ea1bd7103720c773b48ce130643115d

Depends-On: Iad6b3a88639bb4a0dc3aea5af2ba0162dfa19f96
Change-Id: I6024fbe89d3d8f673be223bd5a07b1068be12034

subject: Stop saying that containerized undercloud is experimental
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-13 00:09:29.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/v1/undercloud_deploy.py'], 'message': "Stop saying that containerized undercloud is experimental

It's not experimental anymore and we'll actually make the default in

Change-Id: Ic8f7e633084376570fb9802dee23afe93b58d299
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Stop saying that containerized undercloud is experimental

It's not experimental anymore and we'll actually make the default in
Rocky.

Change-Id: Ic8f7e633084376570fb9802dee23afe93b58d299

subject: Switch pep8 job to python 3
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 16:11:17.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Switch pep8 job to python 3

pep8 under python 3 is more strict than under python 2, so to make
sure our projects meet the more strict standards we want to run the
pep8 jobs using python 3 by default.

Change-Id: Ief10b732be1294bf1f843291311c716b65e6b8be
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Switch pep8 job to python 3

pep8 under python 3 is more strict than under python 2, so to make
sure our projects meet the more strict standards we want to run the
pep8 jobs using python 3 by default.

Change-Id: Ief10b732be1294bf1f843291311c716b65e6b8be

', 'number': 33}, {'created': '2017-11-17 00:00:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add is_admin_project check to policy for non scoped operations

If an operation is not scoped to a project, only calls
from a token scoped to the admin project should be used.

This patch makes an exception for the Service token
that is used to validate other tokens, as that is likely
to break many deployments.  That operation will be addressed
in a separately to avoid delaying this change for
the most essential and sensitive operations.

Partial-Bug: 968696

to break many deployments.  That operation will be addressed
in a separately to avoid delaying this change for
the most essential and sensitive operations.

Domain and Service operations are also often performed with
tokens scoped to the default domain that contain admin roles.
This pattern has been "grandfathered in" as well.

commit_message:
Add is_admin_project check to policy for non scoped operations

If an operation is not scoped to a project, only calls
from a token scoped to the admin project should be used.

This patch makes an exception for the Service token
that is used to validate other tokens, as that is likely
to break many deployments.  That operation will be addressed
in a separately to avoid delaying this change for
the most essential and sensitive operations.

Domain and Service operations are also often performed with
tokens scoped to the default domain that contain admin roles.
This pattern has been "grandfathered in" as well.

Partial-Bug: 968696

Change-Id: Ibfa6c076f7a657aeeb1d1fc943c8040e115c765f

commit_message:
Admin API policy enforcement contingent on is_admin_project

In order for a user with the admin role to be able to perform
administrative actions, the role must be assigned to a project
that is deemed the "admin" project in the Keystone server.
This prevents someone being assigned admin on some random
project from being admin everywhere.

Co-Authored-By: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>
Change-Id: I94da64ef20fd8a01ddf17a51acbd89a982b46327
Closes-Bug: 968696

', 'number': 5}, {'created': '2016-10-14 15:47:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'API Policy enforcement contingent on is_admin_project

In order for a user with the admin role to be able to perform
administrative actions beyond their current project, that project
must be deemed the "admin" project in the Keystone server.

This prevents someone being assigned admin on some random project
from being admin everywhere.

Note that there is a transition mechanism implemented in oslo-context
that prevents this change from breaking existing deployments.  If
no key 'is_admin-project" exists in the token's auth-data, oslo-context
defaults the value to true.  This protects Nova against breaking when a
Keystone server has not yet been updated.  Once Keystone sets the value
in the auth-data, Nova will endforce on the corresponding
'is_admin_project' value.


Co-Authored-By:Matthew Edmonds <edmondsw@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I5b7dc9be639354e246722369566641a666df6284
Closes-Bug: 968696

', 'number': 14}, {'created': '2017-05-16 16:09:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Admin API Policy contingent on is_admin_project

In order for a user with the admin role to be able to perform
administrative actions beyond their current project, that project

commit_message:
Admin API Policy contingent on is_admin_project

In order for a user with the admin role to be able to perform
administrative actions beyond their current project, that project
must be deemed the "admin" project in the Keystone server.

This prevents someone being assigned admin on some random project
from being admin everywhere.

Note that there is a transition mechanism implemented in
oslo-context that prevents this change from breaking
existing deployments.  If no key 'is_admin_project" exists
in the token's auth-data, oslo-context defaults the value
to true.  This protects Nova against breaking when a
Keystone server has not yet been updated.  Once Keystone
sets the value in the auth-data, Nova will enforce on
the corresponding 'is_admin_project' value.

Co-Authored-By: Matthew Edmonds <edmondsw@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I5b7dc9be639354e246722369566641a666df6284
Closes-Bug: 968696

", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-04-13 12:47:54.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/legacy/tempest-post-common.yml'], 'message': "Zuul: Avoid POST_FAILURE when OVSDB files doen't exist

commit_message:
Zuul: Avoid POST_FAILURE when OVSDB files doen't exist

If a job fails before the OVSDB files are created they are being marked
as POST_FAILURE instead of only FAILURE by the gate. This is because the
post job will try to copy the OVSDB files as part of the collection logs
task but, if the files doesn't exist the post job will also fail.

This patch is verifying if the ovnsb_db.db file exist [0] prior to trying
to copy and compact them.

This patch is also inverting the order of the post file to first check
the databases and compact it and then collect the logs. Otherwise the
databases won't show up in the logs.

[0] The ovnsb_db.db file was choosen because it's the last one of the
the db files that will be created.

Change-Id: I9f12f5113ef23c236167f3dbe53016e1351e7f13

commit_message:
Stop updating port status when Felix times out.

During scale testing, we found that updating port statuses
to error when Felix went down could cause DoS due to the
overhead/amplification.  Stop doing that.

Change-Id: Icc99f53222f632ba64f744b3c0e8098788710489

commit_message:
Deprecate auth_uri option

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated[1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: I8b7a88535550831b4390dfcc5025fa3bb34be49c
Depends-On: I4c82a63baabd6b9304b302c97cd751a0103d8316
Closes-Bug: #1759098

subject: Fail more gracefully when passed an empty ip
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-21 21:44:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP fail more gracefully when passed an empty ip

Change-Id: Ie15c585a9a902b577f35a75de191bfa91c132668
NB: probably need to split this off to a function
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-02-22 10:21:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "WIP Fail more gracefully when passed an empty ip

Introduce a new function called is_ip_addresses which will verify
if a string or an array of strings are composed of correct ip addresses.

We do this in order to fail a bit more clearly if we are passed an empty
or broken ip address. Without this the failure will be in pacemaker
failing to start a VIP called 'ip-'.

commit_message:
Fail more gracefully when passed an empty ip

Introduce a new function called is_ip_addresses which will verify
if a string or an array of strings are composed of correct ip addresses.

We do this in order to fail a bit more clearly if we are passed an empty
or broken ip address. Without this the failure will be in pacemaker
failing to start a VIP called 'ip-'.

Also convert the only use of legacy is_ip_address stdlib function in
mysql::client to this new function (for consistency reasons).

Suggested-by: Rhys Oxenham <roxenham@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ie15c585a9a902b577f35a75de191bfa91c132668

set default python to python3

Set the default python to python3 except for the py27 environment. We
have to set that explicitly to override the new default.

commit_message:
Switch pep8 job to python 3

pep8 under python 3 is more strict than under python 2, so to make
sure our projects meet the more strict standards we want to run the
pep8 jobs using python 3 by default.

Change-Id: Ice3cffa36e9167f2f1f30337372cf9187af5e02e

commit_message:
Add Neutron L3 agent failover check during upgrade

This change adds suppport for validating that a router created on
the overcloud before upgrade remains active on the same node between
the various steps of the upgrade process and does not failover.

Change-Id: I1273367fb07bda5cdacb538081a87f9d3e5ece3c
(cherry picked from commit 71aaf58e6f263321c6119bcb2ae9f6f93176941d)

commit_message:
Mount netns as shared to persist namespaces

Dataplane is breaking when containers are killed. Keeping the namespaces
around allows the network objects (ports, bridges) etc. to remain
intact without the containers running.

Closes-Bug: #1748658
Change-Id: I092500e9ec0820347ba0f865f3c24f828980af3a
(cherry picked from commit fb27465c6fb734d7106130765f918ed91bc329ad)

subject: Add GPG-KEY-ceph
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-11 20:24:05.000000000', 'files': ['functions', 'files/GPG-KEY-ceph'], 'message': 'Add GPG-KEY-ceph

At first, I thought this would go in puppet-ceph, but in fact,
every compute node needs a librados dependency which is in the
Ceph repo. So at then end, all nodes need GPG-KEY-ceph, so it
is a good idea to install the repository key there.

Change-Id: Ia33718a8350a60c69ce9632eddb6156f9b43c745
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add GPG-KEY-ceph

At first, I thought this would go in puppet-ceph, but in fact,
every compute node needs a librados dependency which is in the
Ceph repo. So at then end, all nodes need GPG-KEY-ceph, so it
is a good idea to install the repository key there.

Change-Id: Ia33718a8350a60c69ce9632eddb6156f9b43c745

commit_message:
Improved local_ip parameter description in OVS manifest

For some reason VXLAN tunnels are not mentioned in local_ip
parameter's description, which could be mesleading during
troubleshooting.

Change-Id: Ib73808b9ea6318ea98908985e4c640980000f663

commit_message:
vhostuser socket dir shall be created for vhostuserclient mode

In order to support vhostuser client mode, a vhostuser_socket_dir
needs to be created with qemu:qemu g+w permissions.

Closes-Bug: #1675690

Co-Authored-By: Sanjay Upadhyay <supadhya@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I255f98c40869e7508ed01a03a96294284ecdc6a8
Signed-off-by: Karthik S <ksundara@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2556c56b5b8bb84b1846683bb4a21881b35fad08)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-08 03:58:55.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/deprecate_os_region_name_parameter-a12b9e7b5d8cee38.yaml', 'manifests/placement.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_placement_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Deprecate os_region_name option

Option "os_region_name" from group "placement" is deprecated. Use
option "region_name" from group "placement".

Change-Id: I63b915c93165f2c970d5433b6f215514c77972c2
Closes-Bug: #1762107
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Deprecate os_region_name option

Option "os_region_name" from group "placement" is deprecated. Use
option "region_name" from group "placement".

commit_message:
Add proxy support to glance_image resource

The glance_image resource provides the ability to
download remote images using the source parameter.
Specifying the proxy parameter will allow one to
use a proxy server when downloading the image.

Change-Id: I540a29be3eb6c95b1c3975228c23c9154b1a0cbe
Closes-Bug: 1719874

commit_message:
Update Zuul branch limit

Now mitaka and newton already mark as EOL, so we should remove any
branch limit that relative to those branches.

Also since we have dependent zuul jobs for each branch, we remove
ocata branch limit from master.

Change-Id: Ide2ddbe4d50faa0356992b55d99c1b1af8a44a35
(cherry picked from commit ee56adbd791e0ede9c3d92ab0a776d1776de6d47)

commit_message:
Run identity client relations when db is complete

When keystone is deployed with multiple units but without hacluster one
off scenarios occur where one non-leader unit will fail to update its
client relations.

This change runs all identity client relations when the database
relation is complete thus guaranteeing all keystone units update there
identity relation data with clients.

Small timing fix to amulet tests.

Closes-Bug: #1761562
Change-Id: I338e500dbc155b75c75b9261a9b5b471bd73088a

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 8655, 'name': 'Jakub Libosvar', 'email': 'libosvar@redhat.com', 'username': 'jlibosva'}, {'_account_id': 11975, 'name': 'Slawek Kaplonski', 'email': 'skaplons@redhat.com', 'username': 'slaweq'}, {'_account_id': 15752, 'name': 'Intel SR-IOV CI', 'email': 'sriov-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'sriovci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 11:10:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix potential race condition in privileged ip_lib module

Functions like _run_iproute_{link,addr,neigh} are not atomic and
works in two steps.
First it tries to get device index and in second step call specified
command for this device.
It might happen sometimes that device exists during first of those
steps but not exists during second step. Such case cause raising
pyroute2.NetlinkError exception which isn't properly handled in
Neutron code which uses ip_lib module.

This patch fixes it by catching pyroute2.NetlinkError exception
and raising NetworkInterfaceNotFound.
This is child of RuntimeError and all callers of ip_lib can handle
it properly is needed.

Change-Id: I568ef183466f5ff2f2c30ed74a7dc52db41ba577
Closes-Bug: #1763329
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-04-13 07:39:32.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/privileged/agent/linux/test_ip_lib.py', 'neutron/privileged/agent/linux/ip_lib.py'], 'message': "Fix potential race condition in privileged ip_lib module

Functions like _run_iproute_{link,addr,neigh} are not atomic and
work in two steps.
First it tries to get device index and in second step calls specified
command for this device.
It might happen sometimes that device exists during first of those
steps but not exists during second step. Such case causes raising
pyroute2.NetlinkError exception which isn't properly handled in
Neutron code which uses ip_lib module.

This patch fixes it by catching pyroute2.NetlinkError exception
and raising NetworkInterfaceNotFound.
This is subclass of RuntimeError and all callers of ip_lib can handle
it properly is needed.

Change-Id: I568ef183466f5ff2f2c30ed74a7dc52db41ba577
Closes-Bug: #1763329
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fix potential race condition in privileged ip_lib module

Functions like _run_iproute_{link,addr,neigh} are not atomic and
work in two steps.
First it tries to get device index and in second step calls specified
command for this device.
It might happen sometimes that device exists during first of those
steps but not exists during second step. Such case causes raising
pyroute2.NetlinkError exception which isn't properly handled in
Neutron code which uses ip_lib module.

This patch fixes it by catching pyroute2.NetlinkError exception
and raising NetworkInterfaceNotFound.
This is subclass of RuntimeError and all callers of ip_lib can handle
it properly is needed.

Change-Id: I568ef183466f5ff2f2c30ed74a7dc52db41ba577
Closes-Bug: #1763329

commit_message:
Upgrade the content for containerized undercloud

- installing: document how to deploy a containerized undercloud and
  mention that we only support that starting from Rocky cycle.
- updating: document how to upgrade a non containerized undercloud
  on Queens to a containerized undercloud on Rocky.
- containers_deployment/undercloud: consolidate what we had before
  (remove outdated bits), and add links to deploy/upgrade/tips pages.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/546024

Change-Id: Ibd6c8794f3d6a64f65e9a9f0f8b15a472d8424d1

commit_message:
Use cached cirros image

Jobs are downloading the image from cirros (which leads sometimes to dns
error) even though the image is cached locally. Change it to use the
local cirros image instead of download it again

Change-Id: I5f9607bc029a68f4a73a12305ea8e1d605551f15

commit_message:
Manage upgrades to a containerized undercloud

The workflow will be the following:
openstack undercloud upgrade --use-heat

Which will deploy with the UndercloudUpgrade service in THT, in charge
of taking care of tearing down the services running on baremetal, and
then running a classic install by keeping the data.

Depends-On: I36be7f398dcd91e332687c6222b3ccbb9cd74ad2
Change-Id: If8e276cf2758556fcd8d2461b5b841e68fe1b228

commit_message:
Do container image prepare during undercloud deploy

This change consumes the ContainerImagePrepare parameter during
"openstack undercloud deploy" to populate the container image
parameters. This includes doing tag discovery if tag_from_label is
set, and image uploads if push_destination is set.

Rather than creating a separate environment file for these parameters,
the parameters are set directly in the environment if that parameter is
not already set.

Change-Id: I00f72b1cd7ab6a03dd42bc489f3c950ee32dedeb
Blueprint: containerized-undercloud

commit_message:
use rpc Connection rather than create_connection

The create_connection function in neutron.common.rpc is just an alias to
Connection. This patch switches to the later so we can remove the former
in: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560130

Change-Id: I72a8219fc57d2601500cf45312a90a34e493ee54
