subject: Sync hacking requirement with ironic
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 12356, 'name': 'Vladyslav Drok', 'email': 'vdrok@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vdrok'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 12:42:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Sync hacking requirement with ironic

Older hacking appears to break our coinstallability in devstack, as
devstack will install test-requirements.txt, and pbr for some reason
imports modules while installing. Older hacking depends on older flake8
depends on older pep8/pycodestyle, and newer pycodestyle doesn't have a

http://logs.openstack.org/62/511162/43/check/ironic-grenade-dsvm-multinode-multitenant/c201a8a/logs/grenade.sh.txt.gz#_2018-04-12_08_39_09_868

commit_message:
Sync hacking requirement with ironic

Older hacking appears to break our coinstallability in devstack, as
devstack will install test-requirements.txt, and pbr for some reason
imports modules while installing. Older hacking depends on older flake8
depends on older pep8/pycodestyle, and newer pycodestyle doesn't have a
module named pep8 (which older flake8 uses).

http://logs.openstack.org/62/511162/43/check/ironic-grenade-dsvm-multinode-multitenant/c201a8a/logs/grenade.sh.txt.gz#_2018-04-12_08_39_09_868

Also update the tenacity lower-constraints patch to correspond with the
minimum in requirements.txt, else CI will fail on this.

Change-Id: I395734a8ef52319a1f30c04dd5536673686c2d44

Avoid use of autodoc_tree_index_modules

directive to generate module documentation by using the new
sphinxcontrib.apidoc extension.

commit_message:
Remove :return from update_provider_tree docstring

During development of update_provider_tree, it was decided that we don't
need it to return anything - deciding whether things have changed is
handled by the report client.

But somehow we missed removing that bit from the docstring.  This patch
remedies that.

related to blueprint update-provider-tree

Change-Id: I199a13b0a3de9f1cbe3f6419506fe7b37ed6c4ae

commit_message:
fix tox release note generation

The reno package must now be specified in the test-requirements.txt,
otherwise reno is not installed and the tox venv target can't be used
to generate a release note.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/reno/latest/user/usage.html

Change-Id: I114b01c37428a08b6297bb49d1aa3d6678a966f6

This patch updates the inventory code to produce an inventory that uses
hostnames as the host alias. Since the hostname may not always be
resolvable, ansible_host is added as a hostvar and set to the host's IP
address.

Using hostnames produces a much more user friendly result in the ansible
output showing task result and play recap.

The anti-pattern of creating one group per host is also removed in favor
of just adding additional hosts under the role named groups. E.g., the
"Controller" group will now contain 3 hosts when deploying 3 controllers
instead of having 3 child groups, where each child group only had 1
host.

hostvars are again used to set specific values on each host in the role
named group.

commit_message:
Use hostnames in inventory

This patch updates the inventory code to produce an inventory that uses
hostnames as the host alias. Since the hostname may not always be
resolvable, ansible_host is added as a hostvar and set to the host's IP
address.

Using hostnames produces a much more user friendly result in the ansible
output showing task result and play recap.

The anti-pattern of creating one group per host is also removed in favor
of just adding additional hosts under the role named groups. E.g., the
"Controller" group will now contain 3 hosts when deploying 3 controllers
instead of having 3 child groups, where each child group only had 1
host.

hostvars are again used to set specific values on each host in the role
named group.

Change-Id: If834e5e60f79a7418cbc1441d2aaf85507ac7bd2
Closes-Bug: #1752057

dmidecode can return some additional data if SMBIOS is updated. Let's
ensure that the expected output matches the expected UUID format. The
expected string from the 'dmidecode --s system-uuid' call should look

commit_message:
Sanitize the uuid string

dmidecode can return some additional data if SMBIOS is updated. Let's
ensure that the expected output matches the expected UUID format. The
expected string from the 'dmidecode --s system-uuid' call should look
like "79287E4C-2FBF-11B2-A85C-EB9FB9250CBA".

Change-Id: Ib0d19e64b2f24f4a9229f8868795e8979e267f04
Closes-Bug: #1762460

Rist', 'email': 'jrist@redhat.com', 'username': 'jrist'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 00:44:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'haproxy: enable UI endpoint when TripleO UI is enabled

TripleO UI endpoint was never enabled in HAproxy because enable_ui is
wrong. It should be tripleo_ui_enabled to follow the pattern with other
services, and be automatically set to True when the service is actually
enabled, which is the case of the containerized undercloud.

Change-Id: I2f9ef89b6daac2dec4e2af110f5d239a3611f747
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-04-12 01:01:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "haproxy: enable UI on containerized undercloud

TripleO UI endpoint was never enabled in HAproxy because enable_ui is
for instack-undercloud.
It should be tripleo_ui_enabled to follow the pattern with other
services, and be automatically set to True when the service is actually
enabled, which is the case of the containerized undercloud.

For backward compatibility, we'll keep support for enable_ui and use
pick to find which one is defined, otherwise we'll just disable it like
before.

Change-Id: I2f9ef89b6daac2dec4e2af110f5d239a3611f747
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2018-04-12 14:24:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "haproxy: enable UI on containerized undercloud

TripleO UI endpoint was never enabled in HAproxy because enable_ui is
for instack-undercloud.
It should be tripleo_ui_enabled to follow the pattern with other
services, and be automatically set to True when the service is actually
enabled, which is the case of the containerized undercloud.

For backward compatibility, we'll keep support for enable_ui and use
pick to find which one is defined, otherwise we'll just disable it like

commit_message:
haproxy: enable UI on containerized undercloud

TripleO UI endpoint was never enabled in HAproxy because enable_ui is
for instack-undercloud.
It should be tripleo_ui_enabled to follow the pattern with other
services, and be automatically set to True when the service is actually
enabled, which is the case of the containerized undercloud.

For backward compatibility, we'll keep support for enable_ui and use
pick to find which one is defined, otherwise we'll just disable it like
before.

Change-Id: I2f9ef89b6daac2dec4e2af110f5d239a3611f747

commit_message:
Multiprocess object replicator

Add a multiprocess mode to the object replicator. Setting the
"replicator_workers" setting to a positive value N will result in the
replicator using up to N worker processes to perform replication
tasks.

At most one worker per disk will be spawned, so one can set
replicator_workers=99999999 to always get one worker per disk
regardless of the number of disks in each node. This is the same
behavior that the object reconstructor has.

Worker process logs will have a bit of information prepended so
operators can tell which messages came from which worker. It looks
like this:

  [worker 1/2 pid=16529] 154/154 (100.00%) partitions replicated in 1.02s (150.87/sec, 0s remaining)

The prefix is "[worker M/N pid=P] ", where M is the worker's index, N
is the total number of workers, and P is the process ID. Every message
from the replicator's logger will have the prefix; this includes
messages from down in diskfile, but does not include things printed to
stdout or stderr.

Drive-by fix: don't dump recon stats when replicating only certain
policies. When running the object replicator with replicator_workers >
0 and "--policies=X,Y,Z", the replicator would update recon stats
after running. Since it only ran on a subset of objects, it should not
update recon, much like it doesn't update recon when run with
--devices or --partitions.

Change-Id: I9c63bd8d8f8b0630c1061402ccc65b7dd4238891

commit_message:
Refactor replicator command-line-argument handling

Between the account replicator, container replicator, object
replicator, and object reconstructor, we had a couple different ways
of handling --devices, --partitions, and --policies arguments. This
commit refactors them to all use the same helper method.

This will probably be helpful in making the account and container
replicators support multiple worker processes.

Change-Id: I4c642fbcfdfe4a6f91dd4ffdd87ec6c1937f95ca

commit_message:
Don't dump recon stats when replicating only certain policies

When running the object replicator with replicator_workers > 0 and
"--policies=X,Y,Z", the replicator would update recon stats after
running. Since it only ran on a subset of objects, it should not
update recon, much like it doesn't update recon when run with
--devices or --partitions. This commit makes it not update recon in
that case.

Change-Id: I574e5fd5c22bfb52f78f876b9704fe18ff951c63

subject: Make multiprocess replicator's logs more readable
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-26 22:03:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Make multiprocess replicator's logs more readable

When a bunch of object-replicator worker processes are all going at
the same time, their logs get mixed together and it is hard to see
what each one is doing. This is especially true with the stats line,
which contains an estimated completion time.

This commit adds a prefix to the log messages from each worker
process. Example:

  [worker 1/2 pid=16529] 154/154 (100.00%) partitions replicated in 1.02s (150.87/sec, 0s remaining)

The prefix is "[worker M/N pid=P] ", where M is the worker's index, N
is the total number of workers, and P is the process ID. Every message
from the replicator's logger will have the prefix; this includes
messages from down in diskfile, but does not include things printed to
stdout or stderr.

I had considered putting the override devices in there, but that list
can get rather long on systems with many drives but few replicator
workers. Combined with the log-line length limit, that could end up
crowding out the useful parts of log messages. That's why I opted for
just the worker index.

Change-Id: If3ced6b7d0d00e11ed8dcdd040077614ea07c179

commit_message:
Make multiprocess replicator's logs more readable

When a bunch of object-replicator worker processes are all going at
the same time, their logs get mixed together and it is hard to see
what each one is doing. This is especially true with the stats line,
which contains an estimated completion time.

This commit adds a prefix to the log messages from each worker
process. Example:

  [worker 1/2 pid=16529] 154/154 (100.00%) partitions replicated in 1.02s (150.87/sec, 0s remaining)

The prefix is "[worker M/N pid=P] ", where M is the worker's index, N
is the total number of workers, and P is the process ID. Every message
from the replicator's logger will have the prefix; this includes
messages from down in diskfile, but does not include things printed to
stdout or stderr.

I had considered putting the override devices in there, but that list
can get rather long on systems with many drives but few replicator
workers. Combined with the log-line length limit, that could end up
crowding out the useful parts of log messages. That's why I opted for
just the worker index.

Change-Id: If3ced6b7d0d00e11ed8dcdd040077614ea07c179

commit_message:
Cleanups for multiprocess object replicator

Made utils.load_recon_cache() robust to invalid JSON, plus tests. Also
added tests for missing recon file.

Made obj.replicator.Stats robust to new fields on disk in
object.recon. Small refactorings in Stats class. It ended up being
halfway to collections.namedtuple(), but going all the way to
namedtuple made things uglier (IMO), so it remains namedtuple-ish.

Removed one-line _stats_for_dev method on object replicator and just
used self.stats_for_dev[dev] instead.

Change-Id: Idecf5d9050ceb14fabd755275b7c72944bbed9ec

subject: Add bindep.txt file to prevent fallback to generic list
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-20 15:28:24.000000000', 'files': ['bindep.txt'], 'message': 'Add bindep.txt file to prevent fallback to generic list

Jobs will look for bindep.txt in each repo to get a list of required
system packages to be installed. If that file is not found, it will
fallback to a generic bindep.txt file that contains many things that
are not needed for running oslo.utils jobs (things such as mysql and
postgres packages).

This adds a basic bindep.txt file with just a few packages to speed
up job setup times and prevent unnecessary work in the gate.

Change-Id: I9cc50095b7b9a151184f131b1a4735da6c3f83dd
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add bindep.txt file to prevent fallback to generic list

Jobs will look for bindep.txt in each repo to get a list of required
system packages to be installed. If that file is not found, it will
fallback to a generic bindep.txt file that contains many things that
are not needed for running oslo.utils jobs (things such as mysql and
postgres packages).

This adds a basic bindep.txt file with just a few packages to speed
up job setup times and prevent unnecessary work in the gate.

Change-Id: I9cc50095b7b9a151184f131b1a4735da6c3f83dd

subject: versioned object plugin registry
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-16 16:05:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'DNM PoC for decouple neutron OVO

DO NOT MERGE

This is sample patch that illustrates how a dynamic OVO registry could
work in order to decouple neutron (OVO) object consumption. As part of
the proposal neutron (OVO) objects are exposed as stevedore entry
points that consumers can access via a simple generic plugin registry
in neutron-lib.

This patch implements a simple scheme/API allowing consumers to get
neutron objects exposed as stevedore entry points. Using the registry
module herein, consumers can load classes and/or create new instances
of neutron objects exposed via entry points.

For more details see the spec on commit [1] and on this git topic
branch.

[1] I079d06502e6e7b1e20aea882979b0ecd9106eaeb

Change-Id: I39d9bab1e24fbcbd5f9b3abf80560da920f1cf26

commit_message:
versioned object plugin registry

This patch implements the plumbing to support dynamically loadable
plugins for neutron versioned objects as per the spec [1]. Specifically
a utility class is introduced as a generic plugin manager for stevedore
based plugins in a given namespace. A global singleton instance of this
plugin manager is then wrapped to provide access to neutron versioned
objects.

Using this implementation:
- Neutron version object classes are registered as entry points. For
example [2].
- Consumers can then use the object registry in neutron_lib to access
them, for example [3].

As-is this change doesn't introduce any breakage risk; it's new
functionality that no one is using.

[1] I079d06502e6e7b1e20aea882979b0ecd9106eaeb
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/553836/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/553835/

Change-Id: I39d9bab1e24fbcbd5f9b3abf80560da920f1cf26

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 13:54:51.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'message': "Make the nova-multiattach job non-voting temporarily

Since Icb971831c8d4fe5f940d9e7993d53f1c3765e30f merged
in devstack to use the Queens UCA, the nova-multiattach
job has been failing to start nova-compute due to permission
errors connecting to libvirt, which probably has something
to do with the stack user not having access to the proper
libvirt(d) group.

It's weird since this was working in change
I0962474ff6dfc5fa97670c09a1af97a0f34cd54f to make the
nova-multiattach job use the Queens UCA.

Anyway, let's make it non-voting to stop the bleeding while
we can figure out the actual problem.

Change-Id: I3911c902cecfa8e66fccffd9fe0e4f462eacd588
Related-Bug: #1763382
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make the nova-multiattach job non-voting temporarily

Since Icb971831c8d4fe5f940d9e7993d53f1c3765e30f merged
in devstack to use the Queens UCA, the nova-multiattach
job has been failing to start nova-compute due to permission
errors connecting to libvirt, which probably has something
to do with the stack user not having access to the proper
libvirt(d) group.

It's weird since this was working in change
I0962474ff6dfc5fa97670c09a1af97a0f34cd54f to make the
nova-multiattach job use the Queens UCA.

Anyway, let's make it non-voting to stop the bleeding while
we can figure out the actual problem.

Change-Id: I3911c902cecfa8e66fccffd9fe0e4f462eacd588
Related-Bug: #1763382

commit_message:
fix lower constraints and uncap eventlet

Fix the lower constraints to match the expected values.

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I61d5680182c53774713ee83808b1f6e7a4fba9ff
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Bug fix: fwaas_v2 was missing in the pip task

Closes-Bug:#1752073

The neutron_optional_fwaas_pip_packages was never used because only
neutron_fwaas was checked. This patch adds neutron_fwaas_v2 to the
list

Change-Id: I45247cd4fe9a54dde6c866e23b1a62a0632467a3
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>
Depends-On: Ifa33e5aedd06e1c0cc44d03354d56de18db46932
(cherry picked from commit eec4b767a59e71a718eff0889dc8ee074fc846f0)

commit_message:
Add lower-constraints job

- Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.
- Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.
- Add a lower-constraints job that runs unit tests with a Py35
environment constrained by lower bounds.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I000e03759f7a5065c96493c0064785a1f010de4e
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Co-Authored-By: Michel Peterson <michel@redhat.com>

delegate_to should never delegate to omit, as omit is only
intended for task argument's values.
More explanations of the reasons can be found in the bug.

Change-Id: Ief2fecbc266adcc816336b601253d3e90c39c32b
Closes-Bug: #1763300
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Do not delegate to omit

delegate_to should never delegate to omit, as omit is only
intended for task argument's values.
More explanations of the reasons can be found in the bug.

Change-Id: Ief2fecbc266adcc816336b601253d3e90c39c32b
Closes-Bug: #1763300

commit_message:
Fix constraints and uncap eventlets

Some lower-constraints did not match the lower bounds in the
requirements file(s).

Details at:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129056.html

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I2c9978041206d31b191f8d2bbc34b18d93411472

commit_message:
Fix paramater name in xclarity driver

The paramter name has no other references. It turns out
that the manager_ip address is what is used.

I guess this is a side effect of undergoing so many
revisions. :(

Change-Id: Ia831097849d808b39d9ade0ac7e7f5fcdc349642

commit_message:
Fixes missing 'flat' network type for ODL OVS

The allowed network types were missing 'flat', which will allow nodes to
attach nova instances to flat networks.  This should be allowed by
default.

Partial-Bug: 1762495

Change-Id: Iccee353763823fddd18dc6bbbd857a71f1c2320a
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8cf40527c40237b2812e07ff4eb86d721409cd3e)

commit_message:
Remove config.json for old style nic config files when using new style

This removes the config.json used by os-apply-config for old style nic
config files in the script invoked for new style nic config files.
This will avoid the case when the network files are set up by
run-os-net-config.sh and then later overwritten by os-apply-config.

Change-Id: I8f17a53c392aac657b00afdecbb5e58a2e192787
Closes-Bug: 1758161
(cherry picked from commit 9f4c691ccae4be6aa93e40450717b35f16a2a655)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-06 02:23:57.000000000', 'files': ['accessbot/channels.yaml'], 'message': "Remove openstack-101 from accessbot

In discussions at the last PTG[1] and in subsequent First Contact
SIG meetings[2] we've decided that the #openstack-101 channel
should be removed and rolled into the #openstack-dev channel.

Why? Good qustion:
 - No one is good at sitting in and watching the #openstack-101
   channel outside of OUI training periods.
 - It would be better for new contributors to ask questions in
   a channel that people with the answers already activly monitor.
 - 101 is an American-ism, that not everyone in the world would
   understand.

This means that during OUI trainings there will be more noise in
openstack-dev. However, trainings mostly happen the weekend
before a summit, so at a very quiet time. And would mean trainees
would already have practice and now where to come for questions.

There is another patch[3] which will remove openstack-101 from
the status and meet bots.

Finally, as per renaming instructions[4], once these patches
land, a redirect will need to be created, the topic updated and
current residents of the channel will need to be informed to
relocate.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/FC_SIG_Rocky_PTG
[2] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/First_Contact_SIG#Meeting_Agenda
[3] https://review.openstack.org/559249
[4] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/system-config/irc.html#renaming-an-irc-channel

Change-Id: Ic63184138d361f6a5da0eed8446c166fee446833
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove openstack-101 from accessbot

In discussions at the last PTG[1] and in subsequent First Contact
SIG meetings[2] we've decided that the #openstack-101 channel
should be removed and rolled into the #openstack-dev channel.

Why? Good qustion:
 - No one is good at sitting in and watching the #openstack-101
   channel outside of OUI training periods.
 - It would be better for new contributors to ask questions in
   a channel that people with the answers already activly monitor.
 - 101 is an American-ism, that not everyone in the world would
   understand.

This means that during OUI trainings there will be more noise in
openstack-dev. However, trainings mostly happen the weekend
before a summit, so at a very quiet time. And would mean trainees
would already have practice and now where to come for questions.

There is another patch[3] which will remove openstack-101 from
the status and meet bots.

Finally, as per renaming instructions[4], once these patches
land, a redirect will need to be created, the topic updated and
current residents of the channel will need to be informed to
relocate.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/FC_SIG_Rocky_PTG
[2] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/First_Contact_SIG#Meeting_Agenda
[3] https://review.openstack.org/559249
[4] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/system-config/irc.html#renaming-an-irc-channel

Change-Id: Ic63184138d361f6a5da0eed8446c166fee446833

commit_message:
rehome get_deployment_physnet_mtu into plugin utils

While [1] rehomed a build of the neutron.plugin.common.utils into lib,
as per [2] get_deployment_physnet_mtu is intended for public
consumption. This patch rehomes it.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/532329/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/549313/5/neutron/plugins/common/_utils.py@23

Change-Id: I73f5e8ad7a1a83392094db846d18964d811b8bb2

commit_message:
Fix test_show_server_usage not checking expected attributes

While os_compute_api:os-server-usage policy in Nova is deprecated [0]
the current test in Patrole should be fixed since it is not
checking for expected attributes which are conditionally injected
following successful policy authorization. See [0] for details
on expected attributes.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/15f1caf98a46ba0ab3f8365075c564e89f06eef3/nova/policies/server_usage.py#L32

commit_message:
openvswitch: use pidfile option

Make appctl to search pidfile for exit command as pid 1 is not
always the target process in some cases. For example, pid 1 is
"pause" when pid namespace sharing is enabled in your k8s cluster.

Change-Id: I90e202245a9522fe53bea7e1f047061a0a280834

commit_message:
Shard range updates should not revive deleted container

...unless they have non-zero object stats.

Before, *any* shard range update received by a deleted container would
bump its put timestamp and revive it. Now, shard range updates do not
bump the put timestamp, but are still accepted by a deleted
container. If the shard range update has non-zero object count then
the container will be revived, just as if an object update had been
received after the delete timestamp. Otherwise the container will
remain deleted.

Shard range updates will still autocreate a container in the .shards
account namespace.

Unlike object updates, shard range updates may also update container
metadata.

Change-Id: If48e588783bc02104b2405169bd69bc3219572d4

subject: remove lower bounds from global requirements
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-10 18:05:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'remove lower bounds from global requirements

Now that we allow projects to diverge in their lower bounds, it no
longer makes sense for us to track "global" lower bounds values. We
need to retain the exclusion specifiers (using the "!=" operator) so
that the automatic constraint update calculation continues to produce
a set of values that we expect to work.

In addition to updating the data, this patch updates the validation
rules so that if a lower bound is included an error is reported.

commit_message:
remove lower bounds from global requirements

Now that we allow projects to diverge in their lower bounds, it no
longer makes sense for us to track "global" lower bounds values. We
need to retain the exclusion specifiers (using the "!=" operator) so
that the automatic constraint update calculation continues to produce
a set of values that we expect to work.

In addition to updating the data, this patch updates the validation
rules so that if a lower bound is included an error is reported.

Change-Id: If9da4636755fc089b2ec5f075e03767f84c34a67
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Revert "Allow to clone extras if zuul cloner is not presented"

This reverts commit dad6bee340fa15b07cfddcdd79e58ab070c0549d.

With dad6bee340fa15b07cfddcdd79e58ab070c0549d, jobs were not picking up 
the tripleo-quickstart-extras changes from ZUUL.
Looking at jobs, tripleo-quickstart-extras changes were not being 
deployed to /usr/local/share/ansible/roles.

With the change reverted, the jobs work again.
See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560112/- which depends on the 
revert to test this.

Change-Id: I24fd5534125986c76708c01838d80a9427a660f4

commit_message:
Bug fix: fwaas_v2 was missing in the pip task

The neutron_optional_fwaas_pip_packages was never used because only
neutron_fwaas was checked. This patch adds neutron_fwaas_v2 to the
list

We aim to reuse to those pcs creation commands in upcoming work, so
let's refactor them into their own functions.

subject: Fix the checking of directories for extensions
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 17:43:05.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_titles.py'], 'message': 'Fix the checking of directories for extensions

The test for file extensions was checking everything returned by
glob.glob("guidelines/*"). The recent merge of the refactored HTTP
guidelines added a new guidelines/http/ directory, and the test was
failing because that entry didn't end with either .rst or .json. This
patch corrects that by skipping directories from that name check.

Change-Id: I0a84160015e9c1d96cb456b07c5e45fc6645df08
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix the checking of directories for extensions

The test for file extensions was checking everything returned by
glob.glob("guidelines/*"). The recent merge of the refactored HTTP
guidelines added a new guidelines/http/ directory, and the test was
failing because that entry didn't end with either .rst or .json. This
patch corrects that by skipping directories from that name check.

Change-Id: I0a84160015e9c1d96cb456b07c5e45fc6645df08

commit_message:
Convert infra-puppet-apply jobs to non-legacy

This patch moves the infra-puppet-apply jobs out of legacy/ and into
jobs.yaml. It also condenses the four different run playbooks and four
different post playbooks into one run playbook and one post playbook
since they were all identical. This includes the infra-puppet-apply-4
playbook. A future patch will implement a puppet 4 playbook properly as
an experimental job.

The job configuration remains centralized in openstack-zuul-jobs rather
than in the individual puppet module repositories.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/557507
Change-Id: Icb705a5af11afa01ec889ec28b3cf5ef29ab4a11

commit_message:
Install mon servers in parallel.

The ceph-ansible roles handle restarting services in serial via a
script, so we shouldn't need to run this in serial.

Change-Id: Ia2f2694abe02af282e7a98fcc40410b0510cc1cd
Closes-Bug: #1741085
(cherry picked from commit 6a4c1bdc6b6849c61f78540e7728be534ce7876b)

commit_message:
remove unused common exceptions

This patch removes a handful of unused exceptions from
neutron.common.exceptions as follows:

The following exceptions already live in neutron-lib and are thus
duplicates in neutron:
PlacementEndpointNotFound
PlacementResourceProviderNotFound
PlacementInventoryNotFound
PlacementAggregateNotFound
PlacementInventoryUpdateConflict
NetworkVlanRangeError
PhysicalNetworkNameError
MacAddressGenerationFailure

The following exception is not used anywhere today:
TenantNetworksDisabled

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: Ie8227954681292ead1da0dedc950c54028ce84f1

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I6faaf54f43345979245545acff9051c6f1465a58
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
